critique: The executive order primarily aims to convey a sense of urgency and resolve in addressing the needs of the war effort. While it doesn't explicitly aim to evoke strong emotions, it implicitly relies on a sense of shared purpose and the necessity of overcoming obstacles. The initial scores reflect a moderate level of concern (fear) and determination (joy), with a slight hint of surprise at the extraordinary measures being taken. The revised scores adjust the emphasis to better reflect the underlying emotions, increasing the sense of urgency (fear) and resolve (joy) while reducing the element of surprise.
